# INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentResponse

**Class**

Your app’s response to a set seat settings in car intent.

## Declaration

```swift
class INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentResponse
```

## Overview

An [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentResponse] object contains the status of changing the seat settings in the user’s vehicle. You create instances of this class when confirming or handling a set seat settings in car intent.

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentHandling/handle(intent:completion:)] methods of your set seat settings in car handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentHandling].

## Initializing the Response Object

- **init(code:userActivity:)**: Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Getting the Response Code

- **code**: The code indicating whether you successfully handled the intent.
- **INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentResponseCode**: Constants indicating the state of the response.

## CarPlay Seat Settings

- **INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntentHandling**: The handler interface for changing a vehicle’s seat-related settings.
- **INSetSeatSettingsInCarIntent**: A request to change the seat-related settings in a CarPlay-enabled vehicle.

## Inherits From

- INIntentResponse

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
